intro: Weihea insignis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Weihea insignis thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii.
